list.name: Changes
list.comment: We have started to install our required installations from npm as per the tutorial.

task.summary: Default task
Started setting up my django project
Started setting up my django project
Started setting up my django project
made some edits to my django project
added some bootstrap and css stuff to my base html file
added some bootstrap and css stuff to my base html file
added some css design along with some changes to my home.html and base.html.
added a new table to our sql database
Made some edits to my django blog project. Still have some errors that I have to fix, may potentially have to restart the project

We are redoing the django project, first doing a walkthrough to get familiar with it, and then we will begin to build from there. Right now we have successfully created our app and set up our url patterns, we have just added our blog app to our list of installed apps to begin accessing HTML templates for rendering

So I have established the users app and a template where users can now register (however, I haven't yet created a system in which the users input data is saved to the database). I have made some edits to the url patterns to include the users app and making navigation a little smoother.

We have created a new Users Registration form that will inherit from the default registration form for users that Django provides us, but instead it now adds a new field called the email field which the user can now input an email, however, it is optional if they want to put an email or not

We have structured the login and logout pages for the users along with a profile page for the user as well. We have also made it so that whenever a user is made, a default profile will automatically be made for them as well

We have structured the login and logout pages for the users along with a profile page for the user as well. We have also made it so that whenever a user is made, a default profile will automatically be made for them as well
We have made some edits in the way we are displaying our users blogs. We have made a system for them to edit their accounts and are working on a feature that will let them also create enw blogs

We have now given the user the ability to update and delete their blogs, however, we have a system in place that will make sure that the user in session is the one who created that blog before they can do anything to it. We also are making the update and delete options more accessible
We have added a paginator that splits up the blogs into different pages for the user to access
We have added an image attribute to allow users to add an image to their Post, and we are going to be working on hopefully adding an option in the users homepage to look at other users
We have added an image attribute to allow users to add an image to their Post, and we are going to be working on hopefully adding an option in the users homepage to look at other users

We have added the option for people to look at the post of other users along with the ability to look at the post made by specific users as well. Next I hope to add a comment section for users to comment on post
Currently working on creating the comment database and also the ability for users to add comments to post
Cuwe have given users the ability to comment on post, still working out a bug though on the return url after the user submits the comment
Fixed the issues relating to the comments attribute
Added a chat feature in which users can chat with other users so long as they are logged in
creation of chat table and its modifications
We are starting a project in which we will be developing and auctioning system
We are starting a project in which we will be developing and auctioning system
We are starting a project in which we will be developing and auctioning system
We have successfully given the user the ability to add an auction, to be able to also log in and register. The next goal is to display the auctions on the page

We are still making edits to our auction page. We have edited the register function in our views so that it automatically creates a profile for each registered user. We also are working on the profile page to allow users to view their profile. More aspects to come as this is just a rough draft

We are still making edits to our auction page. We have edited the register function in our views so that it automatically creates a profile for each registered user. We also are working on the profile page to allow users to view their profile. More aspects to come as this is just a rough draft

We have created a template for updating the users profile, we are still working out a few bugs and playing around with the media roots as well.Once we get the profile stuff done, the goal is to start working on the bidding system.
We have successfully fixed the update form for the users profile and are now working on the bid attribute of the project, allowing users to place their bids on auctions of their choice.

We have created a page where the auctioneer can see all the bids on their auction, and we have set the view bids button option to appear only if it is the auctioneer that is logged in, and we have set the place bid button to appear if only if anyone other than the auctioneer is logged in. Next we will try to give the users anonymous names and also potentially give the bidders the ability to see the current winning bid

We have created a page where the auctioneer can see all the bids on their auction, and we have set the view bids button option to appear only if it is the auctioneer that is logged in, and we have set the place bid button to appear if only if anyone other than the auctioneer is logged in. Next we will try to give the users anonymous names and also potentially give the bidders the ability to see the current winning bid
We have started a new project, following a tutorial and learning how to use rest_framework in django code
We have started a new project, following a tutorial and learning how to use rest_framework in django code
We have started to install our required installations from npm as per the tutorial.

Made some edits to my django blog project. Still have some errors that I have to fix, may potentially have to restart the project

We are redoing the django project, first doing a walkthrough to get familiar with it, and then we will begin to build from there. Right now we have successfully created our app and set up our url patterns, we have just added our blog app to our list of installed apps to begin accessing HTML templates for rendering

So I have established the users app and a template where users can now register (however, I haven't yet created a system in which the users input data is saved to the database). I have made some edits to the url patterns to include the users app and making navigation a little smoother.

We have created a new Users Registration form that will inherit from the default registration form for users that Django provides us, but instead it now adds a new field called the email field which the user can now input an email, however, it is optional if they want to put an email or not

We have structured the login and logout pages for the users along with a profile page for the user as well. We have also made it so that whenever a user is made, a default profile will automatically be made for them as well
We have made some edits in the way we are displaying our users blogs. We have made a system for them to edit their accounts and are working on a feature that will let them also create enw blogs

We have now given the user the ability to update and delete their blogs, however, we have a system in place that will make sure that the user in session is the one who created that blog before they can do anything to it. We also are making the update and delete options more accessible
We have added a paginator that splits up the blogs into different pages for the user to access
We have added an image attribute to allow users to add an image to their Post, and we are going to be working on hopefully adding an option in the users homepage to look at other users

We have added the option for people to look at the post of other users along with the ability to look at the post made by specific users as well. Next I hope to add a comment section for users to comment on post
Currently working on creating the comment database and also the ability for users to add comments to post

We are starting a project in which we will be developing and auctioning system
We have successfully given the user the ability to add an auction, to be able to also log in and register. The next goal is to display the auctions on the page

We are still making edits to our auction page. We have edited the register function in our views so that it automatically creates a profile for each registered user. We also are working on the profile page to allow users to view their profile. More aspects to come as this is just a rough draft

We have created a template for updating the users profile, we are still working out a few bugs and playing around with the media roots as well.Once we get the profile stuff done, the goal is to start working on the bidding system.
We have successfully fixed the update form for the users profile and are now working on the bid attribute of the project, allowing users to place their bids on auctions of their choice.

We have created a page where the auctioneer can see all the bids on their auction, and we have set the view bids button option to appear only if it is the auctioneer that is logged in, and we have set the place bid button to appear if only if anyone other than the auctioneer is logged in. Next we will try to give the users anonymous names and also potentially give the bidders the ability to see the current winning bid
